Text: Give ear to my words, O LORD; consider my groaning.
Context: The psalmist is invoking the attention of the Lord, expressing a sense of desperation or deep need.

Text: Attend to the sound of my cry, my King and my God, for to You I pray.
Context: The psalmist is directing their prayer to God, acknowledging His sovereignty and the relationship of worshipper to worshipped.

Text: In the morning, O LORD, You hear my voice; in the morning I lay my requests before You and wait in expectation.
Context: The speaker expresses trust in God’s attentiveness and exhibits a patient attitude of expectation.

Text: For You are not a God who delights in wickedness; no evil can dwell with You.
Context: This verse is a declarative statement about the character of God, emphasizing His holiness and separation from evil.

Text: The boastful cannot stand in Your presence; You hate all evildoers.
Context: It expresses God‘s opposition to pride and evil behavior, emphasizing His justice and righteousness.

Text: You destroy those who tell lies; the LORD abhors the bloodthirsty and deceitful man.
Context: The intensity is heightened by the strong language of God’s active judgment upon liars and violent, deceitful individuals.

Text: But I, by Your great mercy, will enter Your house; I will bow down toward Your holy temple in reverence of You.
Context: Contrasting God‘s treatment of the wicked with His treatment of the faithful, the psalmist expresses gratitude for the privilege of worship.

Text: Lead me, O LORD, in Your righteousness because of my enemies; make straight Your way before me.
Context: There is a plea for guidance and protection against adversaries, indicating a trust in God’s ability to provide direction and preserve the psalmist.

Text: For not a word they speak can be trusted; destruction is within them. Their throat is an open grave; with their tongues they speak deceit.
Context: An intense indictment of the character of the wicked, using vivid imagery to describe their deceitful nature.

Text: Declare them guilty, O God; let them fall by their own devices. Cast them out for their many transgressions, for they have rebelled against You.
Context: The psalmist is asking for justice, for the wicked to be caught in their own schemes and punished for their rebellion against God.

Text: But let all who take refuge in You rejoice; let them ever sing for joy. Spread Your protection over them, that those who love Your name may exult in You.
Context: An expression of joy and trust in God‘s protection for the righteous, with a communal aspect of shared rejoicing among the faithful.

Text: For surely, O LORD, You bless the righteous; You surround them with your favor as with a shield.
Context: Concluding the psalm with a confident assertion of God’s favor and protection for the righteous, likened to a shield that surrounds them.
